Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Mouthful \Mouth"ful\, n.; pl. {Mouthfuls}. 1. As much as is usually put into the mouth at one time. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence, a small quantity. [1913 Webster]
3. A statement that has a profound truth in it; as, you said a mouthful! [informal] [PJC]
mouthful n 1: the quantity that can be held in the mouth 2: a small amount eaten or drunk; "take a taste--you'll like it" [syn: {taste}]
